result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Current: 1006 Elm Street, Merrill, WI 54452 United States  (Effective: 04-30-2021)
Prior: PO Box 1034, USP Coleman #2, Coleman, FL 33521 United States
05-03-19 Plea & Sentencing Transcript

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 2:03 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF639, 15CF1174, 15CM967, 15CM1464, 15CM1908, 16CF117, 16CF588, AND 15TR3395. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears by phone from Federal Custody with Atty Andrew Morgan. 

**BENCH WARRANTS QUASHED**

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

Atty Morgan notes 16CF588 was previously dismissed WITHOUT prejudice and requests that file be dismissed WITH prejudice. 
No objection. 
COURT grants - 16CF588 is dismissed WITH prejudice. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF1174: Ct. 3>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1464: Ct. 2>>DISMISS. 
                       : Cts. 3 & 4>>D&RI. 
In 15CM1908: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
In 16CF117: Cts. 1-6>>D&RI. 
In 15TR3395: Ct. 1>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF639: Ct. 1 (Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF1174: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                      : Ct. 2 (Obstructing an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM967: Ct. 1 (Battery/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM1464: Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF639: Ct. 1>>4 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 
                    : Ct. 2>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC & 1 yr ES. 
In 15CF1174: Ct. 1>>4 yrs imprisonment - 2 yrs IC & 2 yrs ES. 
                      : Ct. 2>>9 months MCJ. 
In 15CM967: Ct. 1>>2 yrs imprisonment - 1 yr IC & 1 yr ES. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no contact with D.R.; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 

In 15CM1464: Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: $1694 inclusive; 45 days MCJ; 24 months dl revocation with admin credit; 24 months IID; AODA (credit should be given if already done); 6pts against dl. 

COURT finds the def entitled to 309 days jail credit in ALL files. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other and CONCURRENT to any sentence def is currently serving. 
COURT finds the def NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
Deft requests copies of disposition in mail. 
COURT notes Clerk's Office to send JOCs to deft. 

Adj: 2:27 pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Includes 16CF588, 15CF639, 15CF1174, 16CF117, 15CM1908, 15CM1464 and 15CM967.   No contact with D.R., T.F., M.L., A.S., S.M. Absolute sobriety from controlled substances.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 with day reporting.   No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed.
